burlap.domain.stochasticgames.normalform

Class SingleStageNormalFormGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • burlap.domain.stochasticgames.normalform.SingleStageNormalFormGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DomainGenerator

    public class SingleStageNormalFormGame
extends java.lang.Object
implements DomainGenerator
    This stochastic game domain generator provides methods to create N-player single stage games. There is only one object class, a "player" object class, which has one attribute, its player number. A state consists simply of an object instance for each player. Different players maybe have different numbers of available actions and the actions available to each player may have different names. The SingleAction's are created such that a player can only execute a single action if that action is available to that player. Therefore, when agents joint a world for one of these games, their AgentType can be specified to have all of the possible actions, because they will only be able to execute the relevant ones. The method getAgentTypeForAllPlayers(SGDomain) will return such an AgentType class that can be used for all agents.

    In addition to this generator being able to return the domain object, it may also be used to return the corresponding joint reward function. The method getRepatedGameActionModel() will return a joint action mode that always returns to the same state, which can be used for repeated game playing.

    This class also provides static methods for returning generators for a number of classic bimatrix games: prisoner's dilemma, chicken, hawk dove, battle of the sexes 1, battle of the sexes 2, matching pennies, and stag hunt.

    This class also has a method for streamlining the world creation process so that repeated games (or single shot games) can be easily played in the constructed game. For this use either the createRepeatedGameWorld(Agent...) or createRepeatedGameWorld(SGDomain, Agent...) method. The former method will create an new domain instance using the generateDomain() method; the latter will use an already generated version of the domain that you provide to it.

    Finally, this class's payout function definition (and other properties) can be modified without affecting previously generated domains or payout functions, allowing it to be reused multiple times.

    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  SingleStageNormalFormGame.ActionNameMap
      A wrapper for a HashMap from strings to ints used to map action names to their action index.
      static class  SingleStageNormalFormGame.AgentPayoutFunction
      A class for defining a payout function for a single agent for each possible strategy profile.
      protected static class  SingleStageNormalFormGame.NFGSingleAction
      A SingleAction class that uses the parent domain generator to determine which agent can take which actions and enforces that in the preconditions.
      protected static class  SingleStageNormalFormGame.SingleStageNormalFormJointReward
      A Joint Reward Function class that uses the parent domain generators payout matrix to determine payouts for any given strategy profile.
      static class  SingleStageNormalFormGame.StrategyProfile
      A strategy profile represented as an array of action indices that is hashable.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULTBIMATRIXACTIONBASENAME

        public static final java.lang.String DEFAULTBIMATRIXACTIONBASENAME
        When this generator is constructed with a generic bimatrix or zero sum definition (SingleStageNormalFormGame(String[][], double[][][]) or SingleStageNormalFormGame(String[][]), respectively), action names for each row/column will take the form of: DEFAULTBIMATRIXACTIONBASENAMEi where i is the row/column index. More specifically, it will be "actioni", since DEFAULTBIMATRIXACTIONBASENAME = "action"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Attribute name for player number

      • payouts

        protected SingleStageNormalFormGame.AgentPayoutFunction[] payouts
        The pay out function for each player. This each element of the array takes SingleStageNormalFormGame.StrategyProfile objects as input to return the pay out for the player at the given index in the array.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SingleStageNormalFormGame

        public SingleStageNormalFormGame(java.lang.String[][] actionSets,
                         double[][][] twoPlayerPayoutMatrix)
        A constructor for bimatrix games with specified action names.
        Parameters:
        actionSets - a 2x2 array of strings giving the names for each action. actionSets[0][1] returns the name of the second action for the first player.
        twoPlayerPayoutMatrix - A 2x2x2 payout matrix. twoPlayerPayoutMatrix[0][0][1] gives the payout player 1 receives when player takes its first action and player two takes its second action.

      • SingleStageNormalFormGame

        public SingleStageNormalFormGame(double[][] rowPayoff,
                         double[][] colPayoff)
        A construtor for a bimatrix game where the row player payoffs and colum player payoffs are provided in two different 2D double matrices. The action names for each row/column will be named "action0" ... "actionN" where N is the maximum number of rows/columns.
        Parameters:
        rowPayoff - the payoff matrix for the row player
        colPayoff - the payoff matrix for the column player

      • SingleStageNormalFormGame

        public SingleStageNormalFormGame(double[][] zeroSumRowPayoff)
        A constructor for a bimatrix zero sum game. The action names for each row/column will be named "action0" ... "actionN" where N is the maximum number of rows/columns.
        Parameters:
        zeroSumRowPayoff - the payoffs for the row player

      • SingleStageNormalFormGame

        public SingleStageNormalFormGame(java.lang.String[][] actionSets)
        A constructor for games with a symmetric number of actions for each player. The payoffs will not be set.
        Parameters:
        actionSets - an nxm matrix specifying the m actions names for each of the n players. actionSets[i][j] specifies the jth action name for player i

      • SingleStageNormalFormGame

        public SingleStageNormalFormGame(java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> actionSets)
        A constructor for games with an asymmetric number of actions for each player.
        Parameters:
        actionSets - the oredered list of actions for each player. actionSets.get(i).get(j) returns the name of the jth action for the ith player.

      • getState

        public static State getState(SGDomain domain)
        Returns a state object for a domain object generated by a SingleStageNormalFormGame object. This method will examine the domain for the number of players by looking at the discrete attribute range of the playerNum attribute. It will then create a state with that many player object class instances, each with their playerNum attribute set accordingly.
        Parameters:
        domain - a domain object generated by a SingleStageNormalFormGame object
        Returns:
        a state object for a domain object generated by a SingleStageNormalFormGame object, with the appropriate number of player object instances.

      • getAgentTypeForAllPlayers

        public static AgentType getAgentTypeForAllPlayers(SGDomain domain)
        Returns an AgentType object that can be used by agents being associated with any player number. This AgentType permits agents to use any action in the domain, but the action preconditions will prevent the agent from taking actions that its player number cannot take.
        Parameters:
        domain - the domain in which the the agents will be playing.
        Returns:
        an AgentType object that can be used by agents being associated with any player number.

      • getRepatedGameActionModel

        public static JointActionModel getRepatedGameActionModel()
        Returns a repeated game joint action model. This action model always returns to the same state.
        Returns:
        a repeated game joint action model.
